content.story_intro: Diseña IAM para healthcare SaaS. 10K+ patients, 200 providers, HIPAA compliance

steps.title: Requirements
steps.content: Healthcare platform. Patient portal, provider EHR access, admin functions. Data: PHI (Protected Health Information). HIPAA compliance mandatory. Multi-tenant SaaS (cada hospital = tenant).
steps.insight: HIPAA = strict access controls, audit logs, encryption. PHI access es heavily regulated.

steps.title: Tu Misión
steps.content: Diseñar: 1) User types y roles. 2) Authentication (MFA strategy). 3) Authorization (RBAC/ABAC). 4) Audit logging. 5) Tenant isolation. 6) Compliance controls.
steps.insight: Healthcare IAM = complex. Balance security, usability, compliance.

unlock_content.title: Role Design
points: Patients: View own records, schedule appointments, message providers
Providers (Doctors/Nurses): View assigned patients, update charts, prescribe
Admins: User management, billing, reports
Super Admin: System config, security settings (break glass)
SoD: Billing admin ≠ Clinical admin (fraud prevention)
unlock_content.bonus_fact: HIPAA: Minimum necessary rule. Provider sees ONLY patients they treat, not entire database.

unlock_content.title: Auth Implementation
points: Patients: Passwordless (magic link/SMS code) OR password + TOTP. Lower friction.
Providers: Password + MFA mandatory. FIDO2 for doctors (highest privilege).
SSO: Integrate hospital AD/Okta via SAML/OIDC.
Session timeout: 15 min idle for PHI access (HIPAA best practice).
Device trust: Register devices, anomaly detection on new device.
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Healthcare breach avg cost: $10M+. Strong auth is cheapest insurance.

unlock_content.title: Authorization Design
points: RBAC baseline: Roles defined above.
ABAC enhancement: IF (provider.specialty='Cardiology' AND patient.condition='heart') THEN allow.
Tenant isolation: Hospital A providers CANNOT see Hospital B data. Database-level RLS (Row-Level Security).
Emergency access: Break-glass for ER. Log heavily. Require justification.
API authorization: OAuth 2.0 scopes. Fine-grained permissions.
unlock_content.bonus_fact: Multi-tenancy bug = HIPAA violation. Patient data leak across hospitals = catastrophic.

unlock_content.title: Logging & Compliance
points: Audit log: WHO accessed WHAT PHI WHEN. Immutable logs. 6-year retention (HIPAA).
SIEM: Real-time monitoring. Alert on: bulk data access, off-hours access, geographic anomalies.
Access reviews: Quarterly. Manager certifies provider access.
Compliance reports: HIPAA audit trail. Automated generation.
Encryption: At-rest (AES-256), in-transit (TLS 1.3), backups encrypted.
unlock_content.bonus_fact: HIPAA audit: Must produce access logs. No logs = automatic violation. $50K+ per incident.

unlock_content.title: IR for PHI Breach
points: Detection: SIEM alert on anomalous PHI access.
Containment: Disable compromised account. Isolate affected systems.
Notification: HHS (60 days), affected individuals (60 days), media if 500+.
Forensics: Determine scope. How many records? Root cause?
Uber lesson: DO NOT cover up. Transparency is legal requirement.
unlock_content.bonus_fact: HIPAA breach notification: https://ocrportal.hhs.gov/ocr/breach/breach_report.jsf - Wall of Shame public.

unlock_content.title: Cost Estimate
points: SSO/IdP: Okta Healthcare $8/user/month × 200 = $19K/year
MFA: Duo Healthcare $6/user/month × 200 = $14K/year
FIDO2 keys: YubiKey × 200 doctors = $10K one-time
SIEM: Splunk Cloud $5K/GB, ~$60K/year for logs
Compliance: HIPAA consultant + audit $30K/year
Training: Security awareness $5K/year
Total: ~$140K/year
unlock_content.bonus_fact: ROI: Single HIPAA breach avg $10M. $140K/year insurance is cheap.
